usa.name: Grand Canyon
usa.description: A massive canyon carved by the Colorado River
kidFacts: It's 277 miles long and over a mile deep!
You can see rock layers that are 2 billion years old
It's bigger than the entire state of Rhode Island

usa.name: Yellowstone
usa.description: America's first national park with geysers and wildlife
kidFacts: Old Faithful geyser erupts every 90 minutes
Home to grizzly bears, wolves, and bison
Sits on top of a supervolcano

usa.name: Mount Rushmore
usa.description: Four presidents carved into a mountain
kidFacts: Each face is 60 feet tall
Took 14 years to carve
The noses are 20 feet long

usa.name: Statue of Liberty
usa.description: Symbol of freedom in New York Harbor
kidFacts: A gift from France in 1886
Her torch is covered in gold leaf
You can climb 354 stairs to the crown

usa.name: Golden Gate Bridge
usa.description: Famous orange bridge in San Francisco
kidFacts: It's painted International Orange color
Can sway 27 feet in strong winds
Took 4 years to build

usa.name: Niagara Falls
kidFacts: 3,160 tons of water flow over every second
You can go behind the falls in a tunnel
Makes its own permanent rainbow on sunny days

usa.name: Great Salt Lake
usa.description: America's Dead Sea - super salty lake
kidFacts: 8 times saltier than the ocean
You can float without trying
Pink from tiny shrimp that live in it

usa.name: Hoover Dam
usa.description: Massive concrete dam creating Lake Mead
kidFacts: Taller than a 60-story building
Contains enough concrete to build a road from New York to San Francisco
Created America's largest reservoir

usa.name: Chicago Skyline
kidFacts: Willis Tower was world's tallest for 25 years
Has more moveable bridges than any other city
The river flows backward - they reversed it!

usa.name: Mississippi River
kidFacts: 4th longest river in the world
A raindrop takes 90 days to travel its length
Mark Twain wrote stories about it

aviationFacts: Airplanes are struck by lightning about once a year, but they're designed to handle it safely
The white trails behind planes are called contrails - they're made of water vapor
The Wright Brothers' first flight was shorter than a Boeing 747's wingspan
Black boxes are actually orange to make them easier to find
Pilots and co-pilots eat different meals in case one gets food poisoning
The Antonov An-225 is the largest plane ever built - as heavy as 100 elephants
Most planes can fly with only one engine
The Boeing factory in Seattle is the largest building in the world by volume
Air travel is the safest form of transportation

trivia.question: What makes airplane windows round?
trivia.answer: Square windows can crack from pressure

trivia.question: Why are airplane tires so strong?
trivia.answer: They're filled with nitrogen and can handle 200mph landings

trivia.question: How high do commercial planes fly?
